verses.verse: Knowest <WH3045> thou the time<WH6256> when the wild goats<WH3277> of the rock<WH5553> bring forth?<WH3205> or canst thou mark<WH8104> when the hinds<WH355> do calve?<WH2342>
Canst thou number<WH5608> the months<WH3391> that they fulfill?<WH4390> or knowest<WH3045> thou the time<WH6256> when they bring forth?<WH3205>
They bow<WH3766> themselves, they bring forth<WH6398> their young ones,<WH3206> they cast out<WH7971> their sorrows.<WH2256>
Their young ones<WH1121> are in good liking,<WH2492> they grow up<WH7235> with corn;<WH1250> they go forth,<WH3318> and return<WH7725> not<WH3808> unto them.
Who <WH4310> hath sent out<WH7971> the wild ass<WH6501> free?<WH2670> or who<WH4310> hath loosed<WH6605> the bands<WH4147> of the wild ass?<WH6171>
Whose <WH834> house<WH1004> I have made<WH7760> the wilderness,<WH6160> and the barren land<WH4420> his dwellings.<WH4908>
He scorneth<WH7832> the multitude<WH1995> of the city,<WH7151> neither<WH3808> regardeth<WH8085> he the crying<WH8663> of the driver.<WH5065>
The range<WH3491> of the mountains<WH2022> is his pasture,<WH4829> and he searcheth<WH1875> after<WH310> every<WH3605> green thing.<WH3387>
Will the unicorn<WH7214> be willing<WH14> to serve<WH5647> thee, or<WH518> abide<WH3885> by<WH5921> thy crib?<WH18>
Canst thou bind<WH7194> the unicorn<WH7214> with his band<WH5688> in the furrow?<WH8525> or<WH518> will he harrow<WH7702> the valleys<WH6010> after<WH310> thee?
Wilt thou trust<WH982> him, because<WH3588> his strength<WH3581> is great?<WH7227> or wilt thou leave<WH5800> thy labor<WH3018> to<WH413> him?
Wilt thou believe<WH539> him, that<WH3588> he will bring home<WH7725> thy seed,<WH2233> and gather<WH622> it into thy barn?<WH1637>
Gavest thou the goodly<WH5965> wings<WH3671> unto the peacocks?<WH7443> or<WH518> wings<WH84> and feathers<WH2624> unto the ostrich?<WH5133>
Which <WH3588> leaveth<WH5800> her eggs<WH1000> in the earth,<WH776> and warmeth<WH2552> them in<WH5921> dust,<WH6083>
And forgetteth<WH7911> that<WH3588> the foot<WH7272> may crush<WH2115> them, or that the wild<WH7704> beast<WH2416> may break<WH1758> them.
She is hardened<WH7188> against her young ones,<WH1121> as though they were not<WH3808> hers: her labor<WH3018> is in vain<WH7385> without<WH1097> fear;<WH6343>
Because <WH3588> God<WH433> hath deprived<WH5382> her of wisdom,<WH2451> neither<WH3808> hath he imparted<WH2505> to her understanding.<WH998>
What time<WH6256> she lifteth up herself<WH4754> on high,<WH4791> she scorneth<WH7832> the horse<WH5483> and his rider.<WH7392>
Hast thou given<WH5414> the horse<WH5483> strength?<WH1369> hast thou clothed<WH3847> his neck<WH6677> with thunder?<WH7483>
Canst thou make him afraid<WH7493> as a grasshopper?<WH697> the glory<WH1935> of his nostrils<WH5170> is terrible.<WH367>
He paweth<WH2658> in the valley,<WH6010> and rejoiceth<WH7797> in his strength:<WH3581> he goeth on<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> the armed men.<WH5402>
He mocketh<WH7832> at fear,<WH6343> and is not<WH3808> frightened;<WH2865> neither<WH3808> turneth he back<WH7725> from<WH4480> <WH6440> the sword.<WH2719>
The quiver<WH827> rattleth<WH7439> against<WH5921> him, the glittering<WH3851> spear<WH2595> and the shield.<WH3591>
He swalloweth<WH1572> the ground<WH776> with fierceness<WH7494> and rage:<WH7267> neither<WH3808> believeth<WH539> he that<WH3588> it is the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet.<WH7782>

He saith<WH559> among<WH1767> the trumpets,<WH7782> Ha, ha;<WH1889> and he smelleth<WH7306> the battle<WH4421> afar off,<WH4480> <WH7350> the thunder<WH7482> of the captains,<WH8269> and the shouting.<WH8643>
Doth the hawk<WH5322> fly<WH82> by thy wisdom,<WH4480> <WH998> and stretch<WH6566> her wings<WH3671> toward the south?<WH8486>
Doth the eagle<WH5404> mount up<WH1361> at<WH5921> thy command,<WH6310> and make her nest on high?<WH7311> <WH7064>
She dwelleth<WH7931> and abideth<WH3885> on the rock,<WH5553> upon<WH5921> the crag<WH8127> of the rock,<WH5553> and the strong place.<WH4686>
From thence<WH4480> <WH8033> she seeketh<WH2658> the prey,<WH400> and her eyes<WH5869> behold<WH5027> afar off.<WH4480> <WH7350>
Her young ones<WH667> also suck up<WH5966> blood:<WH1818> and where<WH834> the slain<WH2491> are, there<WH8033> is she.<WH1931>
